message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: public Date(String date) {
    StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(date, "/");
    int m = Integer.parseInt(st.nextToken());
    int d = Integer.parseInt(st.nextToken());
    int y = Integer.parseInt(st.nextToken());
    if(y<100) {
        y += 2000;
    }
    setComponents(m,d,y);
}
public void setComponents(int month, int day, int year) {
    if (month < 1 || month > 12 || year < MIN_YEAR || day < 1 || day > numDaysInMonth(month, year)) {
        throw new IllegalArgumentException();
    }
    this.month = month;
    this.day = day;
    this.year = year;
}
<<<explanation>>>: The StringTokenizer class is used to split the string into tokens. The StringTokenizer.nextToken() method is used to get the next token from the string. In this case, the string is split by the "/" delimiter. The tokens are then parsed into integers and used to set the date components. If the year is less than 100, 2000 is added to it to get the correct year. The setComponents method is then used to set the month, day, and year. If any of the values are out of range, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
